node.title: Japan's former princess leaves for US with commoner husband
node.alt: A man and a woman pass through airport security, with border passes in hand.
node.description: Princess Mako will build a new life in New York, after being forced to exit the royal family due to her marriage to a commoner.
node.content:
["Japan's former\u00a0princess Mako has\u00a0boarded a plane\u00a0for her new home in\u00a0New York,\u00a0leaving\u00a0behind the nation that criticised her marriage to a commoner.", "The departure of Princess Mako\u00a0and her husband Kei Komuro\u00a0from Tokyo's Haneda airport was broadcast\u00a0live by major Japanese broadcasters.", "The couple married last month\u00a0without a wedding banquet or any of the other usual celebratory rituals.", "Mr Komuro, a graduate of Fordham University law school, works at a New York law firm.", "\"I love Mako,\" he told reporters last month after registering their marriage in Tokyo.", "
Gender-based rules for royals
", "Although Japan appears modern in many ways, values about family relations and the status of women remain somewhat antiquated, rooted in feudal practices.", "Such views were demonstrated in the public's reaction to the marriage.", "Some Japanese felt\u00a0they had a say on the matter because taxpayer money supports the imperial family system.", "The negative media coverage surrounding Princess Mako's marriage gave her what palace doctors described last month as a form of traumatic stress disorder.", "Only women are required to leave the Japanese royal family if they marry\u00a0a commoner.\u00a0", "Princess Mako, a museum curator, is the niece of Emperor Naruhito, who also married a commoner.", "The royal family holds no political power but serves as a symbol of the nation, attending ceremonial events and visiting disaster zones, and remains relatively popular.", "Only men can inherit Japan's Chrysanthemum Throne. Princess Mako is the daughter of the emperor's younger brother, and her 15-year-old brother is expected to eventually be emperor.", "", "
The couple departed on Sunday\u00a0for New York, where Mr Komuro works at a law firm.\u00a0(AP:\u00a0Eugene Hoshiko)
", "When Mr Komuro returned from the US\u00a0in September, the couple was reunited for the first time in three years.", "They met while attending Tokyo's International Christian University a decade ago.", "In announcing their marriage, the former princess\u00a0made her choice clear.", "\"He is someone I cannot do without,\" she said.", "AP"]
